metadata.title: CVE-2018-2591 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server : Partition). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.38 andprior and 5.7.19 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.9 (Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-2591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.20-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required
